place.name: GRAVELEY
place.gazetteerText: GRAVELEY, a parish in the district of St. Neots and county of Cambridge; continuous to Hunts, 3½ miles SE of Offord r. station, and 5 NE of St. Neots. It has a post office under Huntingdon. Acres, 1, 558. Real property, £1, 549. Pop., 301. Houses, 59. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Value, £312. * Patron, Jesus' College, mitive Methodist chapel, and charities £48. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
